updates.personalNotes: My home page! I've always wanted to work with a dark UI, so I decided to go with a dark theme for my website. The hero section is the first thing you see when you visit the site, and I wanted it to be visually striking. The about me section is a brief introduction to who I am, and the call to action is a prompt for visitors to check out my projects. The coming soon section is a placeholder for future content.

I knew I wanted to have a project gallery on my website. In terms of design card, I was inspired by Pokemon trading cards which have a clear title in the upper left, a main image in the upper half, and text details in the lower half. I decided to go a bit further and have the cards tilt away from the cursor when hovered as well have a gliding shine effect.

I wish I had this idea for a build log earlier, because I spent some time trying to make the project cards from my gallery flip and grow to take up majority of the page while maintaing a cohesive UI. I ended up scrapping that idea and just making a simple details page with a header, a gallery of images, and a text section for the description. This is the initial skeleton.
